title: 113_s2163
content: EMERGENCY WATERSHED PROTECTION DISASTER ASSISTANCE FUND. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the Emergency Watershed Protection Program, including the program itself, the Fund, and what constitutes a natural disaster. The Emergency Watershed Protection Disaster Assistance Fund is established in the Treasury of the United States to be administered by the Secretary of Agriculture for activities in areas affected by natural disasters. The Fund supplements other Federal funding for natural disasters and is available until expended. The Emergency Watershed Protection Disaster Assistance Fund supplements Federal funding for natural disasters. Amounts directly appropriated to the Fund are available only for specific purposes until transfer authority is granted. The Secretary can transfer unobligated balances to the Fund if no longer needed for the original disaster response. The Emergency Watershed Protection Disaster Assistance Fund allows for the transfer of unobligated amounts for the emergency watershed protection program, subject to certification to the Appropriations Committees. Amounts must either remain unobligated or be from the Disaster Relief Appropriations Act, 2013, and not needed for other purposes. The Emergency Watershed Protection Disaster Assistance Fund allows for the transfer of unobligated amounts for the emergency watershed protection program. This subsection is designated as an emergency requirement under the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Emergency Watershed Protection Disaster Assistance Fund allows for the transfer of unobligated amounts for the emergency watershed protection program as per S. Con. Res. 13 (111th Congress). The Secretary is required to transfer excess amounts to the Fund within 30 days of enactment, in accordance with the Disaster Relief Appropriations Act, 2013. The Secretary may transfer unobligated amounts for the emergency watershed protection program to the Fund, as long as they are no longer needed for natural disaster response. This transfer can occur for appropriations in fiscal year 2014 or later, unless specified otherwise in an appropriations Act. The Secretary can transfer unobligated amounts for the emergency watershed protection program to the Fund if they are no longer needed for natural disaster response. The transfer must be certified to the Committees on Appropriations and cannot occur until 2 years after the original appropriation. Amounts transferred into the Fund are available for the Secretary to use without further appropriation. Administrative expenses are covered separately. The Secretary can use up to 3 percent of allocated funds from the Fund for administrative costs related to natural disasters. There is a limit of $1,000,000 for obligations per natural disaster until 15 days after notifying the Committees on Appropriations. The Secretary can allocate up to 50 percent of the Fund for a natural disaster if there is a specific and extreme need. Quarterly reports on the Fund's status and transactions must be submitted to the Committees on Appropriations.
